Hi everyone, we'd love to hear your thoughts on performance / responsiveness in the updated client after 6.24. If you've seen changes good or bad, please let us know.

I have noticed that sometimes when you go into the shop, you cannot click on any of the tabs to chose what you are looking for (i.e., champions, skins, accessories, etc.) 

Also the addition of weekend game modes (i.e., ARURF, 1-4-All, Nexus Siege, Ascention, etc.). It is sometimes a pain to have to keep switching clients because of the benefits of each client.

Instead of an account button to change summoner name and switch servers, it would be ascetically and functionally more convenient for it to be a main tab under store. 

Last thing. I see Riot is striving to give the summoner all the information from a game via replays and enhanced amount of stats straight from the match history than to go on a web browser. But it would be nice to see what the old client did which gave us stats on certain champions in ranked. I used to try to up my CS per game to look at my average or to see how much i have played then and how well i did with a single champion. With the new client, it only tells us games played and win ratio. Which in my case, doesn't do much. 

Sorry for the ramble. Those are things that I feel would help make the client better and more useful for everyone. By implementing some ideas from the old client to the new one!

Hoped this helped out a bit!

Thanks for listening

-InfernoFoxxx

We have some updates to the shop planned for early next year that will make the shop smoother.

We added support for rotating game modes to the updated client with 6.24. The first one that'll be available will be Snowdown.

We've had conversations internally about "providing more career stats". This is something we'd eventually want to do but likely won't be coming until after beta.
